Was out looking for a traditional cast iron hot plate. Thanks to this video I found the best: Rommelsbacher !
The cheap chinese crap might work but thermostat is crap. It's not thermally linked to the plate and the current causes the thermostat to warm up. Thus it's more like a timed on/off switch.
The traditionel hot plate is perfect for use at the table whether it's dumplings "æbleskiver"/ebleskiver, waffles or just to keep something warm. For that use induction cookers is not ideal because of the noisy fan. A cozy click once in a while is perfectly acceptable.
The wattage for the travel hot plate is on the tiny side though. 500w is quite slow. Might have been sufficient for induction but IMHO on the quite slow side for cast iron burners. I ended up buying the AK 2099 - at 2000w it's quite quick. Made in Germany - quality wise there's no comparison with cheaper chinese alternatives. The Rommelsbacher wins hands down any time.
I'm sure hotels want people slopping up the rooms by cooking in them.
